intro: Agiella welwitschii, commonly known as the Welwitsch agiella, is a rare and striking plant native to the arid regions of Namibia. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Aizoaceae, characterized by its unique, fleshy leaves and vibrant, star-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in extreme drought conditions, storing water in its thick, succulent stems. Its flowers, which bloom in shades of yellow and orange, attract pollinators such as bees and moths. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Agiella welwitschii is considered a vulnerable species.
